faq.q1: What is the turnaround time from intake to live automation?
faq.a1: Average 2 weeks from intake to live. Simple automations are often live within 1 week.
faq.a2: No. We build and implement everything. You get a simple dashboard where you can make adjustments in plain language.
faq.q3: What does automation cost on average?
faq.a3: Starting from €2,500 for standard automation. Complex processes from €5,000. Always a transparent quote upfront.
faq.q4: Does this work with my current systems?
faq.a4: Yes. We connect with 400+ tools such as Google Workspace, Excel, HubSpot, Exact Online, Salesforce, Slack, and more.

faq.title: Everything You Need to Know
faq.subtitle: Still have doubts? These are the questions we get most often. Is your question not listed?
faq.ctaSubtitle: We would be happy to answer them in a non-binding 30-minute call.

items.question: How quickly can I see results?
items.answer: This varies per situation. Sometimes you see the first results within two weeks, for larger custom-made workflows it can take up to three months. It depends on what needs to be built. But one thing is certain: we only start when we have established a clear goal together.

items.question: Do I need to be technical to use this?
items.answer: Absolutely not. Everything we build is designed to be used by everyone, without technical knowledge. You only need to know what you want to achieve, we take care of the rest.

items.question: What are the costs?
items.answer: That depends on what is needed. During the free introductory meeting, we map out what is possible. Afterwards, you will receive a non-binding plan with a clear price indication. No surprises afterwards.

items.question: Does this work with our current software?
items.answer: Yes. We can work with almost all software. And if your system is not standardly included, we often integrate via APIs or webhooks. In short: we always find a way.

items.question: What if it doesn't work as agreed?
items.answer: Then you get your money back. It's that simple. We believe in what we make and strive to deliver the best work for our customers. Doesn't it work? Then you don't pay.

items.question: How do I know if automation is for us?
items.answer: Do you have tasks that repeat and cost a lot of time? Then there is likely something to automate. Think of reading and answering emails, summarizing dossiers, creating quotes, drafting contracts, sending messages, or managing calendars. From back office to front office, from law firm to cafeteria. Every business has annoying chores that can be done faster and smarter.

items.question: What is AI automation for SMBs?
items.answer: AI automation for SMBs means using artificial intelligence to automate repetitive tasks. AIFAIS builds 'Digital Workers' for this purpose: AI agents that independently answer emails, process documents, and handle administration.

items.question: Which tasks can AIFAIS automate?
items.answer: AIFAIS automates administrative tasks such as: email answering, invoice processing, Excel processes, lead follow-up, contract analysis, and reporting. Any task that is repetitive and time-consuming can become a Digital Worker.

items.question: Who helps with AI automation for SMBs in the Netherlands?
items.answer: AIFAIS is a specialist in AI automation for Dutch SMBs. Based in Gouda (South Holland), we help businesses in the Randstad region build Digital Workers that save 40+ hours per week.

items.question: What does AI automation for SMBs cost?
items.answer: Implementation projects start from €2,500. Monthly costs vary from €500 to €2,000, depending on complexity. The average ROI is 20% within 12 months.

items.question: Is AI automation GDPR compliant?
items.answer: Yes. AIFAIS Digital Workers are fully GDPR compliant with Dutch data processing. All data stays within the EU, is stored encrypted, and is never used to train public models.

items.question: How long does implementation take?
items.answer: Standard Digital Worker implementations go live within 8 weeks. More complex projects with multiple system integrations typically take 12 to 16 weeks.

items.question: What is the difference between Digital Workers and chatbots?
items.answer: Digital Workers execute complete workflows (invoicing, data synchronization, lead follow-up). Chatbots only answer questions. A Digital Worker replaces repetitive work, a chatbot only supports communication.

hero.title: Where Agents Do Business
hero.subtitle: Why limit your 'Company Brain' to your own employees? With the x402 standard, external AI agents can securely pay for your data, analyses, and tools. Fully automated. Micro-transactions. Instant settlement.

useCase.title: The First 'Contract Scan' API on the Blockchain
useCase.subtitle: This is not science fiction. We can make your legal models available to agents worldwide today.

card1.title: Universal Access
card1.desc: A purchasing agent from New York can call your Dutch labor law expertise to check a contract. No account needed.

card2.title: Pay-per-Request
card2.desc: No monthly subscriptions. The agent pays per page, per scan, or per millisecond of compute. Directly in USDC.

card3.title: Zero-Trust Security
card3.desc: If no payment is made, the API delivers nothing. The '402 Payment Required' protocol enforces payment before delivery.

tech.title: Integrate in 5 Minutes.
tech.description: We build the x402 gateway for you. To the outside world, it looks like a standard REST API, but underneath it handles complex crypto transactions.

check1.title: Compatible with Everything

problemSolution.title: From 'Plain Text' to
problemSolution.p1: If you ask ChatGPT: 'What did we agree with Peter?', it searches for the name Peter in files.
problemSolution.p2: Our Company Brain works differently. It knows that Peter is the CEO of Company X, that he dislikes phone calls, and that his project is waiting for approval from Finance.
problemSolution.step1: You upload notes, emails, or PDFs.
problemSolution.step2: Graphiti AI automatically makes connections (who knows whom?).
problemSolution.step3: You chat with your company data as if it were a colleague.
